poem:
"Rhythm Resurrectors"

Champions of the jazzed night,
in the vigor of bop they find
truth – echoes of Silver and Blakey,
their notes shaping memory's flight.

No mere craftsmen of past's light,
Their mettle sparks original, varied design.
Throbbing with a vitality hard to confine,
Their melodies – a testament bright.

Echoing 50s, resplendent in 60s time,
Their album glistens in skill refined.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Jazz Defenders: Memory in Motion review – crackles with energy and skill This Bristol quintet are champions – or “defenders” – of the hard bop heritage of greats such as Horace Silver and Art Blakey, players who shaped the golden age of Blue Note records back in the 1950s and 60s. They are not, however, mere nostalgists – their material is original and varied. Their third album crackles with energy and glistens with skill.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The Jazz Defenders: Memory in Motion review – crackles with energy and skill This Bristol quintet are champions – or “defenders” – of the hard bop heritage of greats such as Horace Silver and Art Blakey, players who shaped the golden age of Blue Note records back in the 1950s and 60s. They are not, however, mere nostalgists – their material is original and varied. Their third album crackles with energy and glistens with skill.
